trans-unit.source: Azure App Service Local Cache overview | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service Local Cache overview | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to enable, resize, and query the status of the Azure App Service Local Cache feature
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to enable, resize, and query the status of the Azure App Service Local Cache feature

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service Local Cache overview
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service Local Cache overview

trans-unit.source: Azure web app content is stored on Azure Storage and is surfaced up in a durable manner as a content share.
trans-unit.target: Azure web app content is stored on Azure Storage and is surfaced up in a durable manner as a content share.

trans-unit.source: This design is intended to work with a variety of apps and has the following attributes:
trans-unit.target: This design is intended to work with a variety of apps and has the following attributes:

trans-unit.source: The content is shared across multiple virtual machine (VM) instances of the web app.
trans-unit.target: The content is shared across multiple virtual machine (VM) instances of the web app.

trans-unit.source: The content is durable and can be modified by running web apps.
trans-unit.target: The content is durable and can be modified by running web apps.

trans-unit.source: Log files and diagnostic data files are available under the same shared content folder.
trans-unit.target: Log files and diagnostic data files are available under the same shared content folder.

trans-unit.source: Publishing new content directly updates the content folder.
trans-unit.target: Publishing new content directly updates the content folder.

trans-unit.source: You can immediately view the same content through the SCM website and the running web app (typically some technologies such as ASP.NET do initiate a web app restart on some file changes to get the latest content).
trans-unit.target: You can immediately view the same content through the SCM website and the running web app (typically some technologies such as ASP.NET do initiate a web app restart on some file changes to get the latest content).

trans-unit.source: While many web apps use one or all of these features, some web apps just need a high-performance, read-only content store that they can run from with high availability.
trans-unit.target: While many web apps use one or all of these features, some web apps just need a high-performance, read-only content store that they can run from with high availability.

trans-unit.source: These apps can benefit from a VM instance of a specific local cache.
trans-unit.target: These apps can benefit from a VM instance of a specific local cache.

trans-unit.source: The Azure App Service Local Cache feature provides a web role view of your content.
trans-unit.target: The Azure App Service Local Cache feature provides a web role view of your content.

trans-unit.source: This content is a write-but-discard cache of your storage content that is created asynchronously on site startup.
trans-unit.target: This content is a write-but-discard cache of your storage content that is created asynchronously on site startup.

trans-unit.source: When the cache is ready, the site is switched to run against the cached content.
trans-unit.target: When the cache is ready, the site is switched to run against the cached content.

trans-unit.source: Web apps that run on Local Cache have the following benefits:
trans-unit.target: Web apps that run on Local Cache have the following benefits:

trans-unit.source: They are immune to latencies that occur when they access content on Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: They are immune to latencies that occur when they access content on Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: They are immune to the planned upgrades or unplanned downtimes and any other disruptions with Azure Storage that occur on servers that serve the content share.
trans-unit.target: They are immune to the planned upgrades or unplanned downtimes and any other disruptions with Azure Storage that occur on servers that serve the content share.

trans-unit.source: They have fewer app restarts due to storage share changes.
trans-unit.target: They have fewer app restarts due to storage share changes.

trans-unit.source: How Local Cache changes the behavior of App Service
trans-unit.target: How Local Cache changes the behavior of App Service

trans-unit.source: The local cache is a copy of the /site and /siteextensions folders of the web app.
trans-unit.target: The local cache is a copy of the /site and /siteextensions folders of the web app.

trans-unit.source: It is created on the local VM instance on web app startup.
trans-unit.target: It is created on the local VM instance on web app startup.

trans-unit.source: The size of the local cache per web app is limited to 300 MB by default, but you can increase it up to 1 GB.
trans-unit.target: The size of the local cache per web app is limited to 300 MB by default, but you can increase it up to 1 GB.

trans-unit.source: The local cache is read-write.
trans-unit.target: The local cache is read-write.

trans-unit.source: However, any modifications will be discarded when the web app moves virtual machines or gets restarted.
trans-unit.target: However, any modifications will be discarded when the web app moves virtual machines or gets restarted.

trans-unit.source: You should not use Local Cache for apps that store mission-critical data in the content store.
trans-unit.target: You should not use Local Cache for apps that store mission-critical data in the content store.

trans-unit.source: Web apps can continue to write log files and diagnostic data as they do currently.
trans-unit.target: Web apps can continue to write log files and diagnostic data as they do currently.

trans-unit.source: Log files and data, however, are stored locally on the VM.
trans-unit.target: Log files and data, however, are stored locally on the VM.

trans-unit.source: Then they are copied over periodically to the shared content store.
trans-unit.target: Then they are copied over periodically to the shared content store.

trans-unit.source: The copy to the shared content store is a best-case effort--write backs could be lost due to a sudden crash of a VM instance.
trans-unit.target: The copy to the shared content store is a best-case effort--write backs could be lost due to a sudden crash of a VM instance.

trans-unit.source: There is a change in the folder structure of the LogFiles and Data folders for web apps that use Local Cache.
trans-unit.target: There is a change in the folder structure of the LogFiles and Data folders for web apps that use Local Cache.

trans-unit.source: There are now subfolders in the storage LogFiles and Data folders that follow the naming pattern of "unique identifier" + time stamp.
trans-unit.target: There are now subfolders in the storage LogFiles and Data folders that follow the naming pattern of "unique identifier" + time stamp.

trans-unit.source: Each of the subfolders corresponds to a VM instance where the web app is running or has run.
trans-unit.target: Each of the subfolders corresponds to a VM instance where the web app is running or has run.

trans-unit.source: Publishing changes to the web app through any of the publishing mechanisms will publish to the shared content store.
trans-unit.target: Publishing changes to the web app through any of the publishing mechanisms will publish to the shared content store.

trans-unit.source: This is by design because we want the published content to be durable.
trans-unit.target: This is by design because we want the published content to be durable.

trans-unit.source: To refresh the local cache of the web app, it needs to be restarted.
trans-unit.target: To refresh the local cache of the web app, it needs to be restarted.

trans-unit.source: Does this seem like an excessive step?
trans-unit.target: Does this seem like an excessive step?

trans-unit.source: To make the lifecycle seamless, see the information later in this article.
trans-unit.target: To make the lifecycle seamless, see the information later in this article.

trans-unit.source: D:\Home will point to the local cache.
trans-unit.target: D:\Home will point to the local cache.

trans-unit.source: D:\local will continue pointing to the temporary VM specific storage.
trans-unit.target: D:\local will continue pointing to the temporary VM specific storage.

trans-unit.source: The default content view of the SCM site will continue to be that of the shared content store.
trans-unit.target: The default content view of the SCM site will continue to be that of the shared content store.

trans-unit.source: Enable Local Cache in App Service
trans-unit.target: Enable Local Cache in App Service

trans-unit.source: You configure Local Cache by using a combination of reserved app settings.
trans-unit.target: You configure Local Cache by using a combination of reserved app settings.

trans-unit.source: You can configure these app settings by using the following methods:
trans-unit.target: You can configure these app settings by using the following methods:

trans-unit.source: Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: Configure Local Cache by using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Configure Local Cache by using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: You enable Local Cache on a per-web-app basis by using this app setting:
trans-unit.target: You enable Local Cache on a per-web-app basis by using this app setting:

trans-unit.source: `WEBSITE_LOCAL_CACHE_OPTION` = `Always`
trans-unit.target: `WEBSITE_LOCAL_CACHE_OPTION` = `Always`

trans-unit.source: Azure portal app settings: Local Cache
trans-unit.target: Azure portal app settings: Local Cache

trans-unit.source: Configure Local Cache by using Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Configure Local Cache by using Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: Change the size setting in Local Cache
trans-unit.target: Change the size setting in Local Cache

trans-unit.source: By default, the local cache size is **300 MB**.
trans-unit.target: By default, the local cache size is **300 MB**.

trans-unit.source: This includes the /site and /siteextensions folders that are copied from the content store, as well as any locally created logs and data folders.
trans-unit.target: This includes the /site and /siteextensions folders that are copied from the content store, as well as any locally created logs and data folders.

trans-unit.source: To increase this limit, use the app setting `WEBSITE_LOCAL_CACHE_SIZEINMB`.
trans-unit.target: To increase this limit, use the app setting `WEBSITE_LOCAL_CACHE_SIZEINMB`.

trans-unit.source: You can increase the size up to **1 GB** (1000 MB) per web app.
trans-unit.target: You can increase the size up to **1 GB** (1000 MB) per web app.

trans-unit.source: Best practices for using App Service Local Cache
trans-unit.target: Best practices for using App Service Local Cache

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use Local Cache in conjunction with the [Staging Environments](../app-service-web/web-sites-staged-publishing.md) feature.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use Local Cache in conjunction with the [Staging Environments](../app-service-web/web-sites-staged-publishing.md) feature.

trans-unit.source: Add the _sticky_ app setting `WEBSITE_LOCAL_CACHE_OPTION` with the value `Always` to your **Production** slot.
trans-unit.target: Add the _sticky_ app setting `WEBSITE_LOCAL_CACHE_OPTION` with the value `Always` to your **Production** slot.

trans-unit.source: If you're using `WEBSITE_LOCAL_CACHE_SIZEINMB`, also add it as a sticky setting to your Production slot.
trans-unit.target: If you're using `WEBSITE_LOCAL_CACHE_SIZEINMB`, also add it as a sticky setting to your Production slot.

trans-unit.source: Create a **Staging** slot and publish to your Staging slot.
trans-unit.target: Create a **Staging** slot and publish to your Staging slot.

trans-unit.source: You typically don't set the staging slot to use Local Cache to enable a seamless build-deploy-test lifecycle for staging if you get the benefits of Local Cache for the production slot.
trans-unit.target: You typically don't set the staging slot to use Local Cache to enable a seamless build-deploy-test lifecycle for staging if you get the benefits of Local Cache for the production slot.

trans-unit.source: Test your site against your Staging slot.
trans-unit.target: Test your site against your Staging slot.

trans-unit.source: When you are ready, issue a [swap operation](../app-service-web/web-sites-staged-publishing.md#to-swap-deployment-slots) between your Staging and Production slots.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready, issue a [swap operation](../app-service-web/web-sites-staged-publishing.md#to-swap-deployment-slots) between your Staging and Production slots.

trans-unit.source: Sticky settings include name and sticky to a slot.
trans-unit.target: Sticky settings include name and sticky to a slot.

trans-unit.source: So when the Staging slot gets swapped into Production, it will inherit the Local Cache app settings.
trans-unit.target: So when the Staging slot gets swapped into Production, it will inherit the Local Cache app settings.

trans-unit.source: The newly swapped Production slot will run against the local cache after a few minutes and will be warmed up as part of slot warmup after swap.
trans-unit.target: The newly swapped Production slot will run against the local cache after a few minutes and will be warmed up as part of slot warmup after swap.

trans-unit.source: So when the slot swap is complete, your Production slot will be running against the local cache.
trans-unit.target: So when the slot swap is complete, your Production slot will be running against the local cache.

trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions (FAQ)
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions (FAQ)

trans-unit.source: How can I tell if Local Cache applies to my web app?
trans-unit.target: How can I tell if Local Cache applies to my web app?

trans-unit.source: If your web app needs a high-performance, reliable content store, does not use the content store to write critical data at runtime, and is less than 1 GB in total size, then the answer is "yes"!
trans-unit.target: If your web app needs a high-performance, reliable content store, does not use the content store to write critical data at runtime, and is less than 1 GB in total size, then the answer is "yes"!

trans-unit.source: To get the total size of your /site and /siteextensions folders, you can use the site extension "Azure Web Apps Disk Usage".
trans-unit.target: To get the total size of your /site and /siteextensions folders, you can use the site extension "Azure Web Apps Disk Usage".

trans-unit.source: How can I tell if my site has switched to using Local Cache?
trans-unit.target: How can I tell if my site has switched to using Local Cache?

trans-unit.source: If you're using the Local Cache feature with Staging Environments, the swap operation will not complete until Local Cache is warmed up.
trans-unit.target: If you're using the Local Cache feature with Staging Environments, the swap operation will not complete until Local Cache is warmed up.

trans-unit.source: To check if your site is running against Local Cache, you can check the worker process environment variable `WEBSITE_LOCALCACHE_READY`.
trans-unit.target: To check if your site is running against Local Cache, you can check the worker process environment variable `WEBSITE_LOCALCACHE_READY`.

trans-unit.source: Use the instructions on the [worker process environment variable](https://github.com/projectkudu/kudu/wiki/Process-Threads-list-and-minidump-gcdump-diagsession#process-environment-variable) page to access the worker process environment variable on multiple instances.
trans-unit.target: Use the instructions on the [worker process environment variable](https://github.com/projectkudu/kudu/wiki/Process-Threads-list-and-minidump-gcdump-diagsession#process-environment-variable) page to access the worker process environment variable on multiple instances.

trans-unit.source: I just published new changes, but my web app does not seem to have them.
trans-unit.target: I just published new changes, but my web app does not seem to have them.

trans-unit.source: Why?
trans-unit.target: Why?

trans-unit.source: If your web app uses Local Cache, then you need to restart your site to get the latest changes.
trans-unit.target: If your web app uses Local Cache, then you need to restart your site to get the latest changes.

trans-unit.source: Don’t want to publish changes to a production site?
trans-unit.target: Don’t want to publish changes to a production site?

trans-unit.source: See the slot options in the previous best practices section.
trans-unit.target: See the slot options in the previous best practices section.

trans-unit.source: Where are my logs?
trans-unit.target: Where are my logs?

trans-unit.source: With Local Cache, your logs and data folders do look a little different.
trans-unit.target: With Local Cache, your logs and data folders do look a little different.

trans-unit.source: However, the structure of your subfolders remains the same, except that the subfolders are nestled under a subfolder with the format "unique VM identifier" + time stamp.
trans-unit.target: However, the structure of your subfolders remains the same, except that the subfolders are nestled under a subfolder with the format "unique VM identifier" + time stamp.

trans-unit.source: I have Local Cache enabled, but my web app still gets restarted.
trans-unit.target: I have Local Cache enabled, but my web app still gets restarted.

trans-unit.source: Why is that?
trans-unit.target: Why is that?

trans-unit.source: I thought Local Cache helped with frequent app restarts.
trans-unit.target: I thought Local Cache helped with frequent app restarts.

trans-unit.source: Local Cache does help prevent storage-related web app restarts.
trans-unit.target: Local Cache does help prevent storage-related web app restarts.

trans-unit.source: However, your web app could still undergo restarts during planned infrastructure upgrades of the VM.
trans-unit.target: However, your web app could still undergo restarts during planned infrastructure upgrades of the VM.

trans-unit.source: The overall app restarts that you experience with Local Cache enabled should be fewer.
trans-unit.target: The overall app restarts that you experience with Local Cache enabled should be fewer.
